latestAction.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

item.title: National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2023

latestAction.text: Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent. (consideration: CR S6063-6466)

item.title: Ensuring Access to Abortion Act of 2022
Sergeant First Class Heath Robinson Honoring our Promise to Address Comprehensive Toxics Act of 2022

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 217 - 204 (Roll no. 304). (text: CR H5983)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 217 - 204 (Roll no. 304).
Considered as unfinished business. (consideration: CR H5992-5993)
POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - Pursuant to clause 8, Rule XX, further proceedings on H. Res. 1224 were postponed.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 218 - 208 (Roll no. 303). (consideration: CR H5990-5991)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 1224.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H5983-5991)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 86.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 7900, S. 3373, H.R. 8296, H.R. 8297 and H.R. 6538 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. Measure will be considered read. Specified amendments are in order.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 117-405, by Mr. Morelle.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 117-405, by Mr. Morelle.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 7900) to authorize appropriations for fiscal year 2023 for military activities of the Department of Defense and for military construction, to prescribe military personnel strengths for such fiscal year, and for other purposes; providing for consideration of the bill (S. 3373) to improve the Iraq and Afghanistan Service Grant and the Children of Fallen Heroes Grant; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 8296) to protect a person's ability to determine whether to continue or end a pregnancy, and to protect a health care provider's ability to provide abortion services; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 8297) to prohibit the interference, under color of State law, with the provision of interstate abortion services, and for other purposes; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 6538) to create an Active Shooter Alert Communications Network, and for other purposes.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
